author: zii-dmg
body:
Steps to reproduce
------------------
```powershell
> Get-ComputerInfo

Unhandled Exception: System.EntryPointNotFoundException: Unable to find an entry point named 'GetCur
rentThread' in DLL 'api-ms-win-core-processthreads-l1-1-2.dll'.
   at GetCurrentThread()
   at Microsoft.Management.Infrastructure.Native.OperationHandle.ReleaseHandle()
   at System.Runtime.InteropServices.SafeHandle.InternalFinalize()
   at System.Runtime.InteropServices.SafeHandle.Finalize()
Get-ComputerInfo : Unable to find an entry point named 'GetCurrentThread' in DLL 'api-ms-win-core-p
rocessthreads-l1-1-2.dll'.
At line:1 char:1
+ Get-ComputerInfo
+ ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
    + CategoryInfo          : NotSpecified: (:) [Get-ComputerInfo], EntryPointNotFoundException
    + FullyQualifiedErrorId : System.EntryPointNotFoundException,Microsoft.PowerShell.Commands.Get
   ComputerInfoCommand
```

Environment data
----------------
Windows 7 SP1 x64 Pro
PowerShell 6.0.0 alpha 18 from PowerShell-6.0.0-alpha.18-win7-win2008r2-x64.zip

```powershell
> $PSVersionTable
Name                           Value
----                           -----
GitCommitId                    v6.0.0-alpha.18
SerializationVersion           1.1.0.1
WSManStackVersion              3.0
PSCompatibleVersions           {1.0, 2.0, 3.0, 4.0...}
PSRemotingProtocolVersion      2.3
CLRVersion
PSVersion                      6.0.0-alpha
BuildVersion                   3.0.0.0
PSEdition                      Core
```

comments.author: jeffbi
comments.body:
I don't think this is a `Get-ComputerInfo` issue _per se_. `Get-ComputerInfo` does not use `GetCurrentThread` or any of the threading functions.

The stack trace suggests that the issue is based in releasing a `SafeHandle`. `Get-ComputerInfo` doesn't (directly) use `SafeHandle`s either.

comments.author: iSazonov
comments.body: I never considered this cmdlet as a useful but it really useful! - it helped find already some bugs 😄

comments.author: iSazonov
mirichmo
comments.body:
I duplicated it using Alpha.17. api-ms-win-core-processthreads-I1-1-2.dll is not used by PowerShell Core. The callstack indicates that the call originates in MI .Net (Microsoft.Management.Infrastructure.Native.*), so the bug isn't in PowerShell Core.

The fix would be to address it in MI .Net and update the version of MI .Net that PowerShell Core uses (or just update it if the fix is already published).

comments.author: iSazonov
comments.body:
@mirichmo Thanks for clarify! 

Now we moved to .Net Core 2.0 and we should re-check the bug again.

comments.author: zii-dmg
comments.body: Beta 5 still crashes on Windows 7 x64 (PowerShell-6.0.0-beta.5-win7-win2008r2-x64.zip, PowerShell-6.0.0-beta.5-win7-x86.zip).

comments.author: SteveL-MSFT
comments.body: cc @adityapatwardhan looks like we may missing some other package for MMI to work on Win7

comments.author: zii-dmg
comments.body: Beta 7 still crashes on Windows 7 x64 (PowerShell-6.0.0-beta.7-win-x64.zip, PowerShell-6.0.0-beta.7-win-x86.zip).

title: Get-ComputerInfo : Unable to find an entry point named 'GetCurrentThread'
